title: tread93
author: tread93
content: Ladies and Gents, We have all seen the price drops, the news articles, the videos and just straight chaos in the global markets. The politics have been especially entertaining to watch. Its like we're in the middle of the best TV show ever called life in 2022, haha. I mean seriously what a shit show. I walk into work each day and all my coworkers ask me & hound me on bitcoin or tell me why it won't last, but most of them have no clue. They'll ask me if I'm still buying or holding or if I sold any, and I always tell them of course I keep buying. I just can't help but laugh at all the people who think Bitcoin is dead, when the markets are this crazy and the inflation is up this high and you can get bitcoin at a discount its always a smart decision to get more. In time all of this will pass and we will see new ATHs for years and years to come. If you're in this, then be in it. And if you're out of it and spreading crap all over this forum then please GET OUT! HODL has lost its meaning in 2022, most people seem to be completely jumping ship (besides the majority on this forum). Now is the time to dollar cost average and accumulate while its getting cheaper. Even if it falls back to 3k or even to 1k who cares. Long term vision has always been set to the sky. WE ARE IN THE RIGHT PLACE. Stay positive, do not be dismayed and discouraged. Remember why we are here in the first place. It takes a little while to reach the top of the mountain from the gondola, but only a minute or two to ski all the way down the mountain! This is what is happening with Bitcoin right now. We are almost at the bottom of the hill about to get back on the lift and continue to rise. Me, i'm just enjoying the ride! All the people who never get back on the lift will never know the feeling of that fresh powder in the back bowls (sorry for anyone who doesn't ski in here w/ all the lingo). Today I'm feeling just fine and dandy, i'd say peachy! Lets stack these chips, get your coins! Nobles didn't become nobles miraculously, they took it!!!! Hold your sword steady, and fight with poise knowing full well that we will end up on the right side of history.All the best, All the time, TREAD

comments.author: edgycorner
comments.body: A really optimistic thread amongst all the bad news  I am with you OP, and so are all the people who are in this community since its dawn. Remember "Bitcoina" hack? Remember Mt. gox? BitInstant? CAVIRTEX? And how everyone reacted after all these incidents? 4chan/biz was flooding with "it's over" memes. This crash is nothing compared to what's about to come   Right now people(and HEDGE FUNDS) are treating it like another stock market(and they are right to do so), it's yet to be used with its intended purpose. As more and more people learn about bitcoin and its potential benefits, its value will continue to increase. And when this happens, it won't be just another "inflated" asset. Hopefully we will be alive to witness that day(yes, it's a long road ahead)

comments.author: jrrsparkles
comments.body: If you know what you are doing then its fine, you can make profits if the results came as expected or it can be a lesson, these bulls and bears are not new but for people who are investing may take sometime to get used to that compared to the traditional volatility range. Buying cheaper is the key to make more returns so if you feel this is the cheapest price then buy and stack it until your desired price range happens which may take a year or two but make sure you have enough backup funds in the meantime, don't expect to reap the profits very soon because you may lose the actual potential of your investment with short term trades.

comments.author: Dave1
comments.body: I guess experience is the best teacher, if we haven't seen a bear market, and this is the first time, then a newbie will lose his faith on bitcoin and totally give up. But for those who have seen this before, definitely we won't listen to FUD or any negative thoughts on bitcoin specially in this bear market. Just accept the fact and move on and wait for the next bull market. And for sure, majority of us will see each other again in 2024-2025 when BTC hits $100k or more.

comments.author: btc_angela

And then we will have a laugh moment because we know that is not true and then stay cool. And if we have the chance then we could rub it in to those personalities, sort of trolling them in social media.  , tit for tat and see who is going to crack first.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: One important step is to invest only money you afford to lose. Then you have a better chance neither FUD nor market changes scare you.Reading the news, staying informed.. this is important. Afterwards, based on your knowledge you decide whether those news are worthy to act or not. Indeed, in most cases they are not worthy unless you have trader material and can get to multiply your funds only by paying attention to the market (of course, it's risky!).Being positive is indeed a good advice. Bitcoin has a history of crypto winters and fantastic recoveries afterwards. We can surely hope this is yet another one that'll be followed by recovery.

But for those who have seen this before, definitely we won't listen to FUD or any negative thoughts on bitcoin specially in this bear market. Just accept the fact and move on and wait for the next bull market. And for sure, majority of us will see each other again in 2024-2025 when BTC hits $100k or more.  Despite all the knowledge that a newbie may accumulate there is not really any way to explain to them how a bear market actually feels like, those which have not gone through one have no idea of how difficult it is and as such they overestimate the chances they have of holding their coins even under those circumstances, however if you are one of those which can in fact overcome it then no bear market will ever affect you as you will know what it is like and you will know the price will eventually recover.

I literally disconnected to the crypto so that my decision on buying will not be affcted by FUD. I don't want to miss the next bull run so I will grab this opportunity to buy below 100k.Why would you do that? Information is just information, even FUD. The one who makes the final decision to buy or sell is you. Let's say in the worse possible situation, Bitcoin got a compromise and everyone rushed to sell the coin, how would you feel if you don't know about it and missed the chance to cut loss? Sound like a lot of people in this thread has become a Bitcoin cultist, not a sensible, cool-head investor anymore.
